oai_dc:dc.dc:title: .31 caliber revolver
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This revolver was was found on the grounds of the battlefield at Parker's Crossroads, Tenn. It was most likely dropped in the area later in the war as Fitch & Waldo was not established until 1864. Marked Fitch & Waldo of New York, it was actually made by Bacon Manufacturing Company of Norwich, Connecticut.
